page.title: 11PARISH CHURCHES
page.content: This is a small parish church several kilometres by road from the villages of Middleton-St.-George and Middleton One-row,but central to a number of farms and fairly close to Low Middleton village which used to have a larger population than now. Before the runways of the airport to the north were extended in 1945 people came across the fields from Middleton-St.-George. The church built on high ground above the Tees valley is believed to be a pre- Christian worshipping place. The earliest stone work dates from the 13th century. Much alteration and extension took place in the 18th century. Today a Sunday service is held once a month when,between ten and a hundred people attend.There has been only one wedding in the last 10 years and about one funeral and christening each year.
